response_requirements.initial_response_description: Public body must respond within 5 business days of receipt
response_requirements.final_response_notes: May extend by additional 10 business days with written notice (only one extension permitted)
response_requirements.extension_notes: Must provide reason for extension and new due date; total maximum 15 business days

fee_structure.search_fee_notes: May charge for labor to locate, examine, review, and redact records
fee_structure.copy_fee_notes: May charge actual cost of copying and mailing
fee_structure.fee_estimate_required: Must provide detailed itemization if fees requested
fee_structure.fee_waiver_criteria: Reduced or waived if in public interest or indigent requester

exemptions.description: Information of personal nature where disclosure would constitute clearly unwarranted invasion of privacy
Law enforcement investigative records with specific limitations
Trade secrets and confidential commercial or financial information
Medical records and personal health information

appeal_process.first_level_notes: Must appeal to head of public body within 180 days of denial
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Court may award reasonable attorney fees and damages if public body acted arbitrarily and capriciously

requester_requirements.request_format_notes: Must be in writing; describe records with reasonable particularity

agency_obligations.response_format_options: Must provide detailed itemization of fees if requested
agency_obligations.fee_estimate_required: Must provide detailed fee estimate before proceeding with large requests

validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields manually verified from official Michigan statute. 5 business day response with possible 10 day extension (one extension only, total 15 days max). May charge for labor to locate/examine/redact. Fee waivers available if public interest or indigent. Appeal to agency head within 180 days, then circuit court. Attorney fees if arbitrary and capricious denial. Written request required. FOIA coordinator must be designated.
